page.title: 03THE RIVER WYE: WILDLIFE
page.content: {Fish}in the{River Wye}include salmon, trout, dace, chubb, grayling, pike, stickleback,eel and minnow.Salmon only come into the river to spawn and young eels (elvers) come in on the spring tides.Stocks of salmon are depleted by poachers using mono-filament nets here and over-fishing at sea. Anglers are now forbidden to use the gaff, which can severely injure hen salmon,or lure fish with worms, prawns or shrimps. {Birdlife}includes ducks, swans, geese and sea-gulls as well as dippers, tree creepers, wood-peckers, mergansers , goosanders and king-fishers. Among the{animals}the water-bailiff sees on his rounds are mink, badgers, stoats, weasels, rabbits, hares, foxes and fallow deer. Mink have bred from escapes. Deer are also slaughtered by poachers.
